elements.description:
Simply place the the px-popover next to the element that you want it to attach to. Set the 'for' attribute to the 'id' of the element that it's associated with. Then set the 'popover-title' and 'popover-body' properties, and/or set `enhanced` and pass HTML content as a child of the px-popover. The popover will automatically grow to encapsulate the contents that you have established. NOTE: Currently the popover must be a sibling of the associated trigger element, and both should be contained within a 'static' positioned element such as a DIV. If in a relative positioned ancestor, wrap the trigger and popover in another relative positioned element and set the `position` property to `relative`. Absolute positioned parent elements are not supported. ### Usage
Some element
// If in a relative position ancestor:
Some element
// Passing rich HTML content:
Some element
 ### Styling The following custom properties are available for styling: Custom property | Description :----------------|:------------- `--px-popover-background-color` | Background color for the popover `--px-popover-border-color` | Border color for the popover `--px-popover-text-color` | Color for the text `--px-popover-max-width` | Maximum width of the popover

properties.name: _parentResizable
properties.description: The closest ancestor element that implements `IronResizableBehavior`.

properties.name: _notifyingDescendant
properties.description:
True if this element is currently notifying its descendant elements of
resize.

properties.name: for
properties.description:
The id of the element that the tooltip is anchored to. This element
must be a sibling of the tooltip.

properties.name: orientation
properties.description:
The direction that the popover is displayed relative to the
'for' element.
- 'left' to the left of the 'for' element
- 'right' to the right of the 'for' element
- 'top' above the 'for' element
- 'bottom' below the 'for' element

properties.name: popoverTitle
properties.description: The title that will be displayed in the popover.

properties.name: popoverBody
properties.description: The body text that will be displayed in the popover. Note: Does not support HTML elements within the body. Set `enhanced` and pass HTML as a child of the px-popover instead.

properties.name: position
properties.description: If the target/popover are descendent of a relative position element, wrap the target and popover in another element with relative positioning and set this flag to "relative"

properties.name: showOverlay
properties.description:
By default, the overlay covering the rest of the screen is off.
This property should be set for mobile applications.

properties.name: enhanced
properties.description:
Enhanced empowers the developer to fully control the inner HTML of the popover. For instance, the popover can be used to render a form or contain an embedded video.
To inject your custom HTML, simply include your custom markup as the first child of the px-popover when declaring the px-popover in your application. Sample provided below.

    <px-popover for="someElement" enhanced>
        <form>
           <label>This is a form
             <input type='text'/>
           </label>
        </form>
    </px-popover>

properties.name: _isShowing
properties.description: Whether the popover is currently shown.

methods.name: attached
methods.description: Sets up listeners when popover is created

methods.name: detached
methods.description: Removes listeners when popover is destroyed

methods.name: notifyResize
methods.description:
Can be called to manually notify a resizable and its descendant
resizables of a resize change.

methods.name: assignParentResizable
methods.description:
Used to assign the closest resizable ancestor to this resizable
if the ancestor detects a request for notifications.

methods.name: stopResizeNotificationsFor
methods.description:
Used to remove a resizable descendant from the list of descendants
that should be notified of a resize change.

methods.name: resizerShouldNotify
methods.description:
This method can be overridden to filter nested elements that should or
should not be notified by the current element. Return true if an element
should be notified, or false if it should not be notified.

params.name: element
params.description:
A candidate descendant element that
implements `IronResizableBehavior`.

return.desc: True if the `element` should be notified of resize.

methods.name: _toggle
methods.description: Determines if event should yield a change in the popover visibility and sets up vars associated with the type of show event

methods.name: _setPosition
methods.description: Calculates which direction the popover should go and creates vars used in positioning the popover

methods.name: _positionTop
methods.description: Sets the left and top style attrs to position the popover. Using right or bottom attrs yields changing vars and are thus unreliable.

methods.name: _positionBottom
methods.description: Sets the left and top style attrs to position the popover. Using right or bottom attrs yields changing vars and are thus unreliable.

methods.name: _positionLeft
methods.description: Sets the left and top style attrs to position the popover. Using right or bottom attrs yields changing vars and are thus unreliable.

methods.name: _positionRight
methods.description: Sets the left and top style attrs to position the popover. Using right or bottom attrs yields changing vars and are thus unreliable.

methods.name: showOverlayChanged
methods.description: Adds and removes event listeners if the `hide-overlay` property is changed.

methods.name: _onCaptureClick
methods.description:
Called whenever a click happens if the overlay is hidden.
If the overlay is open and the click came from outside of
the popover, we hide it.

attributes.name: for
attributes.description:
The id of the element that the tooltip is anchored to. This element
must be a sibling of the tooltip.

attributes.name: orientation
attributes.description:
The direction that the popover is displayed relative to the
'for' element.
- 'left' to the left of the 'for' element
- 'right' to the right of the 'for' element
- 'top' above the 'for' element
- 'bottom' below the 'for' element

attributes.name: popover-title
attributes.description: The title that will be displayed in the popover.

attributes.name: popover-body
attributes.description: The body text that will be displayed in the popover. Note: Does not support HTML elements within the body. Set `enhanced` and pass HTML as a child of the px-popover instead.

attributes.name: position
attributes.description: If the target/popover are descendent of a relative position element, wrap the target and popover in another element with relative positioning and set this flag to "relative"

attributes.name: show-overlay
attributes.description:
By default, the overlay covering the rest of the screen is off.
This property should be set for mobile applications.

attributes.name: enhanced
attributes.description:
Enhanced empowers the developer to fully control the inner HTML of the popover. For instance, the popover can be used to render a form or contain an embedded video.
To inject your custom HTML, simply include your custom markup as the first child of the px-popover when declaring the px-popover in your application. Sample provided below.

    <px-popover for="someElement" enhanced>
        <form>
           <label>This is a form
             <input type='text'/>
           </label>
        </form>
    </px-popover>

events.name: px-popover-hide
events.description:
px-popover-hide

Event fired when the px-popover is hidden.
`event.detail.target` contains a reference to the px-popover element.

events.name: px-popover-show
events.description:
px-popover-show

Event fired when the px-popover is shown.
`event.detail.target` contains a reference to the px-popover element.
